H0.text: The sound is reflected more in space, which is why crews of two spaceships a similar distance apart cannot communicate by shouting, unlike the crews of two boats at sea.

H1.text: The pressure is too high inside the spaceships, which is why crews of two spaceships a similar distance apart in space cannot communicate with each other by shouting, unlike crews of two boats at sea.

H2.text: The spaceships are traveling faster than sound, making it impossible for their crews to communicate by shouting across a similar distance in space, unlike the crews of two boats at sea who can shout to each other.

H3.text: There is no air in space for the sound to travel through, which makes it impossible for crews of two spaceships a similar distance apart to communicate by shouting, unlike crews of two boats at sea who can shout to communicate.

A4.text: Sound cannot travel through a vacuum.

A5.text: Sound requires a medium to propagate.
